required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Observational Study to Determine the Association Between Self-rated, Perceived Immune Fitness (Using Questionnaire) With Biological Assessment of Immune Fitness (Immune Signatures in the Blood).

brief_summary.textblock: The overall objective of the study is to determine whether self-rated, perceived immune fitness (using questionnaire) is associated with biological assessment of immune fitness (immune signatures in the blood).

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of different immune cell types in whole blood
primary_outcome.time_frame: 6 - 12 months after the start of the trial
primary_outcome.description: Immune cell type profiling in whole blood by mass cytometry

primary_outcome.measure: Relative quantification of immune protein in plasma
primary_outcome.time_frame: 6 - 12 months after the start of the trial
primary_outcome.description: Proteomic analysis in plasma by proximity extension assay

primary_outcome.measure: Amount of cytokines expressed by peripheral blood mononuclear cells
primary_outcome.time_frame: 6 - 12 months after the start of the trial
primary_outcome.description: Cytokine quantification by proximity extension assay

primary_outcome.time_frame: 6 - 12 months after the start of the trial

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Ability to understand and sign the informed consent
2. Healthy adult men and/or women, 35-65 years old
3. BMI >18 and <30 kg/m2
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Volunteer who cannot be expected to comply with the protocol
2. Individuals with self-reported chronic disease; or who have any clinical condition which the investigator deems relevant for exclusion from the study,
3. Individuals with an impaired immune system that may confound immune response testing; i.e. any condition that impairs participant immune response through either the condition itself or through the treatment of the condition,
4. Family or hierarchical relationships with Clinical Innovation Lab at Nestlé Research, Lausanne, Switzerland
